channel.title: 3D Realms goes kthxbai
channel.description:
[quote] Update: Apogee Software and Deep Silver have issued a statement to Shacknews, confirming that there is a "situation at 3D Realms" but stressing they are not affected.
"Deep Silver and Apogee Software are not affected by the situation at 3D Realms," a representative for the companies has told us. "Development on the Duke Nukem Trilogy is continuing as planned."
In development at Frontline Studios, the Duke Nukem Trilogy represents three new Nintendo DS and PSP titles, with the first, Critical Mass, hitting in September. The trilogy is separate from Duke Nukem Forever, which was in the works at 3D Realms proper.
Original story: A very reliable source close to Duke Nukem Forever developer 3D Realms today confirmed to Shacknews that the development studio has been shut down.
The closure came about as a result of funding issues, our source explained, with the shut down said to affect both 3D Realms and the recently resurrected Apogee. Employees of both entities have already been let go.
Phone calls and e-mails to various 3D Realms veterans have thus far gone unanswered, with 3D Realms publishing partner Take-Two and Apogee partner Deep Silver likewise unavailable for comment.
3D Realms was founded in 1987 by Scott Miller and George Broussard, and was best known for its Duke Nukem series of shooters starring the titular, bubblegum-lacking hero. The studio had infamously been working on Duke Nukem Forever, the next flagship franchise entry, for the past 13 years.
A final push to release Duke Nukem Forever began in 2007, marked by a short teaser starring the in-game hero that was released late that year. [/quote] So yeah...

item.title: 3D Realms goes kthxbai
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Phil:

Fans doing full remakes of games? A bit outlandish, don’t you think?

Imonfire:

No. I’m currently following on a project where fans makes a new Might and Magic game. And it’s coming nice.

Dude, you seriously don’t see the irony/joke in that post?

item.title: 3D Realms goes kthxbai
item.dc:creator: Phil
item.description:
raw_bean:

sigh It always seemed inevitable, and yet I guess I always still somehow believed they’d finish the game. That gameplay footage is really cool, and has got me all nostalgic for Duke 3D. I guess a fan remake is the best I can hope for now.

Fans doing full remakes of games? A bit outlandish, don’t you think?

item.title: 3D Realms goes kthxbai
item.dc:creator: InterloperX
item.description:
Where the hell are they getting the money to fight Take Two’s lawsuit?

That studio truly perplexes me, though I suppose after Daikatana any game studio would be afraid to actually release something as overly hyped (without actual reason) as DNF. 12 years in production though, is a little much.

Read full topic

item.description:

The design docs have already surfaced:
https://ve3d.ign.com/articles/news/46948/Duke-Nukem-Forever-28-Hi-Res-Screenshots-Entire-Plot-Leaked

item.title: 3D Realms goes kthxbai
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
https://www.gamesradar.com/f/duke-nukem-forever-a-life-in-trailers/a-2009051119956131053
Scroll down to the fourth and most epic video.
Anyway, the design of the Ripper was simply epic win. And I laughed my ass of when Duke flicked off that alein spaceship. Ahh… even when the future is dark, Duke will always be badass.
Then there was the football field boss fight, and I knew there was no going back.
Someone NEEDS to pick up Duke Nukem Forever!

Edit: Wow, epic ninja’d.

Also, at the end he says “I can do this all day.” lol

Read full topic

item.description:
intooblivion:

hahah if you look it shows you would have had an “ego” meter.

Wonder what that would have done in terms of gameplay.

Duke Nukem: Manhattan Project’s ‘Ego Meter’ was just the health bar, but you get health from killing things.

Duke Vision?
